title: Calories in Chocolate Chips
meta_description: Discover calories in chocolate chips per 100g, including carbs, sugars, fat, protein, and quick tweaks for recipes.
assumptions: Semi-sweet chocolate chips; standard baking variety, no added nuts or fillings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, type (milk/dark/white), sweetness, and processing; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of semi-sweet chocolate chips contains about 480 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to dark chocolate chips (70% cocoa)
Add 10 g chopped nuts per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g chocolate chips?
faqs.a: Approximately 480 kcal for semi-sweet chocolate chips.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in chocolate chips?
faqs.a: About 60 g carbs per 100 g, including 45 g sugars and 7 g fiber.

faqs.q: Are chocolate chips high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 30 g total fat per 100 g, with 18 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: How do calories differ by chocolate type?
faqs.a: Dark has fewer calories (~430 kcal/100 g); milk has more (~500 kcal/100 g).

faqs.q: What's the protein content in chocolate chips?
faqs.a: Low at about 4 g per 100 g; not a significant protein source.
